citeinfo.origin: City of Asheville via contract with Montreat College
citeinfo.title: City of Asheville On-Street Parking Facilities Within the Central Business District

descript.abstract: City of Asheville On-Street Parking Facilities Within the Central Business District
descript.purpose: Database representation of on-street parking facilities within the CBD

cntperp.cntorg: City of Asheville Transportation & Engineering Department

idinfo.datacred: City of Asheville via contract with Montreat College
idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.1850

attracc.attraccr: Attributes and relationships with meter records were QC'd by Montreat College, with a percentage spot checked in the field by Mr. James Garner of City of Asheville Parking Services. In January 2007, James Garner had reported that 100% of the Meter pole id's and associated meter data observed in the field had matched the deliverables provided by Montreat College. Since that time, it is possible that some meters and poles have been removed, changed, or added with detection. Further maintenance has been planned to make that determination and to retain the currency of this dataset.

qattracc.attracce: Please see accuracy report contents above

dataqual.logic: Positions were verified on-screen using 2002 aerial photography by Montreat College staff.
dataqual.complete: Complete within the CBD as of January 1st, 2007.

horizpa.horizpar: A Trimble GeoXT with an L1 Hurricane Antenna was used to collect the center-point of on-street parking spaces and loading zones within the CBD. After a minimum of 6 hours, each cohort of points was post-processed against CORS base station data (CORS-Swannanoa) using Trimble Pathfinder 3.1 software. Generally, data collected and post-processed using a GeoXT under these conditions may be as accurate as +/- 30cm or more. Montreat College staff did observe several points that were in need of positional correction after processing (per contract specifications ). Generally, if positional corrections were necessary they were completed via on-screen editing using Buncombe County 2002 Orthophotography (1"=100'). If techniques other than those described above are used to maintain the data is this feature class, this section should be altered to reflect a change in methodology.

qhorizpa.horizpav: +/- 2 ft. (post-processed DGPS) OR 1"=100' NMAS (if location is derived via Orthophotography)
qhorizpa.horizpae: Please refer to Horizontal Accuracy Report listed above.

altsys.altenc: Explicit elevation coordinate included with horizontal coordinates

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.
